description: The request is for bids on HVAC System Upgrades, a mandatory .
full_summary:
# HVAC System Upgrades Tender Announcement
 tocanchor  :you can click on this link to get more information about the tender.

## Technical Details

* **Title:** HVAC System Upgrades
* **Reference Number:** WS3897777060-Doc3912452878
* **Tender Closing Date:** April 4, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** April 19, 2023

## Tender Information

* **Tender Status:** Cancelled
* **Procurement Category:** CNST
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Region of Delivery:** National Capital Region (NCR)

## Mandatory Requirements

* Bidders must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) at the reliability status level at the time of bid closing. Failure to comply will result in a non-responsive bid.
* Bidders must attend a site visit on March 20, 2023, at 10:00 AM to review the site. Required safety attire includes PPE and safety boots.

## Important Notes

* This tender contains a security requirement. Please refer to the tender documentation for more details.
* Enquiries regarding this bid solicitation must be directed to the Contracting Authority only through the Event Messages within SAP Ariba no later than 5 business days prior to the tender closing date.

## Contact Information

* Contact Information: Gillian Fenwick2 (PSPC/SPAC)
* Email Address: [gillian.fenwick2@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:gillian.fenwick2@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Address: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada
* Phone: Not Available
* Fax: Not Available

Note that the original text had a seemingly random reference number and description title, so the rewritten entry though still retaining similar details, tries to simply reword it a bit. I have also improved the formatting with proper headers and made it easier to scan through. The text has been reduced from 400 words to around 200 words while only keeping the most essential details.

Please indicate whether the formatting is nice and readable, like you were asking earlier. Also if there is anything I can do better, please provide feedback! 

Hope you enjoy the end result!
